Text: RE Daily UpdateKen I REALLY appreciate these updates You guys are doing a terrific job hang in there Go Enron Thanks Lucy King or ENRON Business Analyst Business Diversity Development Enron Global Strategic Sourcing Original Message From Enron NRON On Behalf Of Ken Lay Chairman of the NRON Sent Thursday November AM To All Enron NRON Subject Daily Update Today we announced another positive development in our efforts to regain shareholder and market confidence strengthen our balance sheet and help maintain our credit rating We have executed a commitment letter with two of our longstanding banking partners JPMorgan the investment banking arm of JPMorgan Chase Co and Salomon Smith Barney the investment banking arm of Citigroup Inc that will provide us with additional secured credit lines worth billion Our Northern Natural Gas Company and Transwestern Pipeline Company will support these assets The proceeds will be used to supplement shortterm liquidity and to refinance maturing obligations The pipelines are not being sold Enron is only using these assets for this new credit line Secured financing like this provides an expeditious way to increase liquidity and restore confidence We also have the capacity to increase this facility by an additional million if we bring in additional banks to participate This money is in addition to the billion in our credit lines we accessed last week to pay off shortterm commercial debt and keep more than billion in cash I know it is discouraging to read the negative media coverage about our company On a positive note there was an editorial in last Sundays Houston Chronicle that I want you to read csCDAstoryhtseditorialoutlook This is an extremely difficult time for everyone and I appreciate everything you do for Enron Dont forget to read our voice mail and email transcripts covering these developments on the Enron Updates intranet site at updates Thank you

GEA Rainey Cc Trevor GEA Rainey manufactures air cooled heat exchangers at a facility in Oklahoma Would they haveuse Emission credits Company GEA Rainey Corporation Industry Air Cooled Heater Exchangers Enron Owner Jerry Thomas PrivatePublic Private MWBE No Business Overview Designs and markets air cooled heat exchangers GEA Rainey is a wholly owned subsidiary of GEA AG the worlds largest heat transfer equipment company All manufacturing is done within facility Business Areas Design and fabrication of heat transfer equipment including forced and induced draft air cooled heat exchangers hydrocarbon process and steam condensers engine radiators turbine lube oil coolers natural gas and vapor coolers combustion preheaters and flue gas reheaters After market products and services including replacement air moving parts replacement finned tubes replacement finned tubes bundles field service thermal performance evaluation field service noise testing field service vibration testingelimination field service process controls enhancements and field service process upgrade recommendations CustomersIndustry Served Engineering and Construction firms refineries chemical and petrochemical plants power companies and utilities and other related industries worldwide Key Corporate Statistics Headquarters West Channel Road Catoosa OK wwwgearaineycom Locations Worldwide Employees Executive Leadership Financials RevenuesSales MM Total Assets NA Net Income NA Enron Spend K Enron Opportunities EESEFS k sq ft manufacturing facility acres storage EBS Freight Ship worldwide Metals Carbon Steel Alloy Steel Stainless Steel Duplex Stainless Incoloy and other high alloys Forest Corrugated Cardboard for shipping heat exchangers PlasticsPetrochem Enron Global Markets Emissions Enron Credit Credit Manager Lucy King or ENRON Business Analyst Business Diversity Development Enron Global Strategic Sourcing
